resources.string: Poker is played with different decks of 32, 36 or 54 cards, but the most commonly used is a standard deck of 52 sheets with equal suits.
Poker is played by several participants, from 2 or more. Usually played by up to 10 participants.

Card values are arranged in descending order from the ace and onwards (king, queen, jack, 10, …, 2). Ace can be considered both as the lowest card to form a sequence (straight) up to 5 inclusive, and as the highest card (in the combination Ace-King-Dama-Valet-10).
Possible combinations of cards in descending order of value:
Royal flush - 5 high cards of the same suit starting with an Ace, for example: T♥️ K♥️ D♥️ B♥️ 10♥️ This is the strongest combination in the game.
Straight flush - Any five cards of the same suit in order, for example: 9♠️ 8♠️ 7♠️ 6♠️ 5♠️. The lowest straight flush (Ace to Five) is sometimes called a "steel wheel".
Four of a kind - Four cards of the same value, e.g: 3♥️ 3♦️ 3♣️ 3♠️. Cards from the table and hand may be stacked, e.g. 2+6.
Full House - One set and one pair, e.g: 10♥️ 10♦️ 10♠️ 8♣️ 8♥️. Cards from the table may be stacked, e.g. 2+6.
Flush - Five cards of the same suit, e.g: K♠️ C♠️ 8♠️ 4♠️ 3♠️.
Straight - Five cards in order of any suit, for example: 5♦️ 4♥️ 3♠️ 2♦️ Т♦️. The ace can both start and end the order.
Three of a kind - Three cards of the same value, e.g: 7♣️ 7♥️ 7♠️ .
Two pairs - Two pairs of cards, e.g: 8♣️ 8♠️ 4♥️ 4♣️.
Pair (pair of kings) - Two cards of the same value, e.g: 9♥️ 9♠️.
High card - None of the above combinations.

In poker, betting occurs in several stages, depending on the type of game. The main stages of betting in classic Texas Holdem (but they may vary in other types of poker) include:
Dealing the cards: Players are dealt cards. In Texas Holdem, each player receives two closed cards (cards that are visible only to themselves).
Preflop: The first round of betting begins with the player to the left of the dealer (or the dealer button). Players have several options: to raise the bet, to call (place the same amount as the previous player), to fold (discard their cards), or to check (skip a turn if there has been no raise before them).
Flop: After completing the betting on the preflop, the dealer places three common cards on the table (the flop). Players start betting again, starting with the player to the left of the dealer. They can bet, check, raise, or fold.
Turn betting: After completing the betting on the flop, the dealer places the fourth common card (the turn). Betting starts again.
River betting: After completing the betting on the turn, the dealer places the last common card (the river). Betting starts again.
Showdown: If after the betting on the river there are two or more players left in the game, they reveal their cards. The player with the strongest card combination wins. If players have the same combinations, the pot is split between them.
This is the basic process of betting in Texas Holdem. In other types of poker, there may be differences in rules and betting stages.
